javadoc:
The interface for groupings of code units that may have attributes such
 as names and comments.

methods.javadoc:
Obtains the comment that has been associated with this fragment or module.
@return may be null.
methods.name: getComment
methods.comment: Obtains the comment that has been associated with this fragment or module.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the comment to associate with this fragment.
@param comment the comment.
methods.name: setComment
methods.comment: Sets the comment to associate with this fragment.

methods.javadoc:
Obtains the name that has been associated with this fragment. A fragment will
 always have a name and it will be unique within the set of all fragment and
 module names.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Obtains the name that has been associated with this fragment. A fragment will
 always have a name and it will be unique within the set of all fragment and
 module names.

methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Sets the name of this fragment.

params.name: name
params.comment: the string to use for the fragment's name.

methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Returns whether this fragment contains the given code unit.

return.comment: true if the code unit is in the fragment, false otherwise.

methods.javadoc: Obtains the number of parent's of this fragment. If a fragment is in a module then the module is a parent of the fragment and the fragment is a child of the module. A fragment must have at least one parent and it may have multiple parents. @return the number of parents of this fragment.
methods.name: getNumParents
methods.comment:
Obtains the number of parent's of this fragment. If a fragment is in a module
 then the module is a parent of the fragment and the fragment is a
 child of the module. A fragment must have at least one parent and it
 may have multiple parents.

return.comment: the number of parents of this fragment.

methods.javadoc: Returns a list of the modules which are parents for this group.
methods.name: getParents
methods.comment: Returns a list of the modules which are parents for this group.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the names of the modules which are parents to this
 fragment.
methods.name: getParentNames
methods.comment:
Returns the names of the modules which are parents to this
 fragment.

methods.javadoc: Returns the name of the tree that this group belongs to.
methods.name: getTreeName
methods.comment: Returns the name of the tree that this group belongs to.

name: Group
comment:
The interface for groupings of code units that may have attributes such
 as names and comments.
